ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Provides the tables from the 'Sean Lahman Baseball Database' as a set of R data.frames. It uses the data on pitching, hitting and fielding performance and other tables from 1871 through 2018, as recorded in the 2019 version of the database. Documentation examples show how many baseball questions can be investigated.

Provides the tables from the 'Sean Lahman Baseball Database' as a set of R data.frames. It uses the data on pitching, hitting and fielding performance and other tables from 1871 through 2018, as recorded in the 2019 version of the database. Documentation examples show how many baseball questions can be investigated.

name: r-lahman
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "14.0-0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-lahman
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Lahman_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/Lahman/Lahman_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 48d05d6ffafb977846b14cfb273d2faf21b5519604cbb337792cb3ec8d25dd31

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('Lahman')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('Lahman')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://lahman.r-forge.r-project.org/
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Provides the tables from the 'Sean Lahman Baseball Database' as a set of R data.frames. It uses the data on pitching, hitting and fielding performance and other tables from 1871 through 2018, as recorded in the 2019 version of the database. Documentation examples show how many baseball questions can be 
    investigated.
  license_family: GPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: Lahman
# Type: Package
# Title: Sean 'Lahman' Baseball Database
# Version: 7.0-1
# Date: 2019-05-01
# Authors@R: c(person(given = "Michael", family = "Friendly", role="aut", email="friendly@yorku.ca"),  person(given ="Chris", family = "Dalzell", role=c("cre","aut"), email="cdalzell@gmail.com"), person(given ="Martin", family = "Monkman", role="aut"), person(given= "Dennis", family = "Murphy", role="aut"),  person(given ="Vanessa", family = "Foot", role="ctb"), person(given = "Justeena", family = "Zaki-Azat", role="ctb") )
# Author: Michael Friendly [aut], Chris Dalzell [cre, aut], Martin Monkman [aut], Dennis Murphy [aut], Vanessa Foot [ctb], Justeena Zaki-Azat [ctb]
# Maintainer: Chris Dalzell <cdalzell@gmail.com>
# Description: Provides the tables from the 'Sean Lahman Baseball Database' as a set of R data.frames. It uses the data on pitching, hitting and fielding performance and other tables from 1871 through 2018, as recorded in the 2019 version of the database. Documentation examples show how many baseball questions can be investigated.
# Depends: R (>= 2.10)
# Suggests: lattice, ggplot2, googleVis, data.table, vcd, reshape2, tidyr, zipcode, knitr, rmarkdown, car
# Imports: dplyr
# License: GPL
# URL: http://lahman.r-forge.r-project.org/
# LazyLoad: yes
# LazyData: yes
# BugReports: https://github.com/cdalzell/Lahman/issues
# Repository: CRAN
# Repository/R-Forge/Project: lahman
# Repository/R-Forge/Revision: 39
# Repository/R-Forge/DateTimeStamp: 2013-06-01 03:33:30
# Date/Publication: 2019-05-02 09:30:03 UTC
# Packaged: 2019-05-02 01:16:13 UTC; dz
# NeedsCompilation: no
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
